1.title: Fear Factor
1.plot: After facing her fear of swimming, Stephanie forces the rest of the family to face their fears as well.

2.title: Mysteries of Maggie
2.plot: Aaron learns that Maggie has a secret career as a romance novelist, but when she denies it, the family tries to get her to reveal her secret identity.

3.title: Ship of Fool
3.plot: When Stephanie tries to teach James and Aaron about selfless generosity, the whole family starts helping Mr. Ebnetter for the wrong reasons.

4.title: No Retreat, No Surrender
4.plot: Stephanie and Charlie stop punishing Gabby and James for fighting, in hopes that they will work things out by themselves.

5.title: Bawamo Shazam
5.plot: With Gabby and the parents arguing, a smug Maggie takes Gabby for the weekend to straighten her out. When Gabby and Maggie get along surprisingly well, Stephanie must show Gabby the "real" Maggie she grew up with.

6.title: Driving Ms. Crazy
6.plot: When a ticket means that Stephanie must ride with Gabby for her to drive, Stephanie begins to get too comfortable with Gabby's friends.

7.title: Basket Case
7.plot: Stephanie helps Aaron win a game against James, but Charlie worries about the consequences. Elsewhere, Gabby is stuck in the middle of a fight between Stephanie and Gabby.

8.title: Turning a Blind Eye
8.plot: Maggie bribes James and Aaron to pretend to be her younger brothers; Gabby is punished for having Noah over.

9.title: Thumper for President
9.plot: After being humiliated by a girl at school, James runs against her in an election; Charlie asks Gabby to help him replace a lost wedding wing.

10.title: Bag Lady
10.plot: Gabby loans Stephanie's purse to a popular girl, but when it gets ruined, Gabby must scramble to replace it.

11.title: Off the Hook
11.plot: James gets a "get out of jail free" card from Stephanie and Charlie and the kids exchange the card among themselves.

12.title: Jamal in the Family
12.plot: The Phillips get a visit from their cousin, but Charlie worries he'll be a bad influence on James. Also, Aaron and Maggie help Gabby prepare for a date.

13.title: Friendly Fire
13.plot: Stephanie asks Aaron to befriend a client's son, not realizing Aaron is terrified of him; Gabby saves Maggie's life.

14.title: Two Guys and a Gabby
14.plot: Gabby uses a childhood friend to make Noah jealous; Stephanie tries to correct Aaron when he accidentally calls her "Mom."

15.title: Crimes of Fashion
15.plot: Stephanie helps James lead a student rebellion when the principal cracks down on the dress code; Gabby teaches Charlie how to use social media.

16.title: Smarty Bowl
16.plot: Stephanie needs to get Gabby's help to stay on top of Aaron's homework so that she will not disappoint him.

17.title: S-A-Tease
17.plot: The night before Gabby takes the SATs, a secret about Stephanie is exposed; James and Aaron have a hard time sharing a room.

18.title: International Incident
18.plot: James tries to trick Stephanie and Charlie into thinking one of his friends is actually a foreign exchange student.

19.title: Yoot There It Is
19.plot: James and Gabby try to make a business out of selling Grandma Maggie's fruit snacks, but when she finds out, she wants a piece of the action.

20.title: Walk Like a Boy
20.plot: After Aaron is brought home by the police, family services must determine whether Stephanie and Charlie are doing a good enough job as parents.

21.title: Dollar Sign
21.plot: Stephanie decides that Gabby needs to get a job and earn money for her car; Maggie and James try to teach the older generations how to speak like teenagers.

22.title: Bug Out
22.plot: Stephanie blames the family for Aaron's alleged funk; they try to change their habits for a week but this only results in more trouble.

23.title: Playa Hata
23.plot: Charlie approves of a boy that Gabby's interested in, which makes her doubt her decision; James finds himself with two girlfriends at the same time.

24.title: Hourly Rage
24.plot: Gabby is the group leader for her school project but when Stephanie discovers that she's acting like a tyrant, she gets involved; Stephanie somehow ends up doing all the work.

25.title: Gone Batty
25.plot: Gabby finds out that her ex's new girlfriend is using him and tries to expose the truth but everyone thinks she's jealous; Charlie, Aaron and Maggie search for a bat.

26.title: Ain't Over Till It's Over
26.plot: Gabby is leaving for college a year early and Stephanie and Charlie consider having a baby; Aaron and James want to live with their mother in Orlando.

1.title: Pilot
1.plot: Stephanie trades in cosmos for carpools when she marries an older man with three kids. Her new role of full-time stepmom is challenging as she struggles to maintain some sense of her fun-loving, slightly irresponsible self.

2.title: The Lying Game
2.plot: Stephanie tells James that lying is OK if it makes someone's day better, which leads him to tell a huge lie. When everyone is called to the principal's office, the family must find a balance between honesty and shading the truth

3.title: Harp & Soul
3.plot: Stephanie's determined to bond with the kids and uses her love of music to do it. But by forcing them to take up an instrument against their will, Stephanie learns a very public and embarrassing lesson in parenting.

4.title: Forty-Two Inches of Pure Evil
4.plot: Stephanie tries to intervene when Aaron has a hard time at school, but she makes matters worse. Gabby's trying out for cheerleading and Maggie volunteers to coach her, but comes off more like a drill sergeant.

5.title: Not a Date
5.plot: Gabby gets asked out by a boy, and she wants to go, but Charlie doesn't want her to date until she's 16. Maggie backs him up, but Gabby sneakily gleans advice from Stephanie on how to get around the rule.

6.title: Rock Mom
6.plot: Stephanie begins to feel old; Stephanie escorts Gabby to an audition for a rock band, and manages to get the gig for herself. James and Aaron try to bribe Maggie for money to buy a video game.

7.title: Dances with She-Wolves
7.plot: Stephanie attempts to get more involved by participating on the parents dance committee at James' school only to find the other mothers mean and unwelcoming to the too pretty, too excited, binder-ready Stephanie.

8.title: In Blog We Trust
8.plot: Stephanie seeks parenting advice by starting an anonymous blog and receives helpful tips until she discovers that the "helpful" users are the kids living under her roof, who have an agenda of their own.

9.title: The Gift of the Maggies
9.plot: Stephanie surprises the family with a visit from her father at Christmas; Stephanie is surprised by Maggie's reaction to her father's visit.

10.title: Staycation
10.plot: Stephanie plans activities at home when the family gets snowed in on their vacation.

11.title: Babysit This
11.plot: Stephanie leaves Gabby in charge when the babysitter cancels on the night of a big event where Charlie is the speaker.

12.title: Dine Hard
12.plot: When Charlie invites his boss over, Stephanie and the children make the wrong impression.

13.title: True Romance
13.plot: Aaron misunderstands Charlie's advice and gives Sam all of Stephanie's jewelry; Gabby decides to torment James.

14.title: A Kids' Choice
14.plot: Gabby and James both submit their own videos to win tickets to a sold-out Cody Simpson concert, but when Aaron wins the tickets with his own video, the family fights over who will go with him.

15.title: Chore Money, Chore Problems
15.plot: Stephanie cancels the maid service and gives the kids chores in an attempt for them to learn responsibility, but her plan backfires when the kids go on strike.

16.title: Requiem for Mr. Floppity
16.plot: Aaron brings his class rabbit home to take care of it for the weekend but after it dies, Stephanie steps in and is determined to explain the nature of loss to Aaron, despite his teacher's objections.

17.title: Buy Any Jeans Necessary
17.plot: Stephanie and Charlie take sides when Gabby is held for shoplifting after returning a pair of jeans with the sensor still on; James sells unopened wedding presents to make extra money.

18.title: Distant Mom
18.plot: The kids return from vacation with their mom in Mozambique, and then they learn that they'll be moving there, far away from Stephanie and Charlie.

19.title: Camp Fear
19.plot: Stephanie leads the family on a camping trip to help Aaron earn a badge, but her lack of experience with outdoor adventures proves to be problematic.

20.title: Not Your Mother's Day
20.plot: Stephanie is excited about celebrating her first Mother's Day until she learns that the family plans to celebrate her on Stepmother's Day instead; Stephanie takes her mother to a day spa and gets some unexpected "mom" advice from a few experts who attempt to cheer her up.

21.title: The Last Auction Hero
21.plot: Stephanie organizes a charity auction to inspire the children to give back; Stephanie goes to extreme measures to beat the previous fund-raising record.

22.title: 48 Hours
22.plot: Stephanie's old pal visits when Charlie's on a business trip, and Stephanie struggles to deal with the kids while living up to her old party-gal reputation.

23.title: Should Old Acquaintance Be for Hire
23.plot: Stephanie bribes Gabby and James to keep a secret when she hires an old boyfriend to install a new sound system for Charlie.

1.title: Sanders Again
1.plot: Stephanie worries that she is working too much when Aaron's imaginary friend returns.

2.title: An Egg by Any Other Name
2.plot: The kids' garden is destroyed by the neighbors, so Stephanie and Charlie seek revenge, and soon the kids follow their bad example.

3.title: Gabby's Game Boy
3.plot: When Stephanie and Charlie learn that Gabby has had a secret boyfriend, they meet him, finding him to be a bad influence.

4.title: Children of the Candy Corn
4.plot: Stephanie feels expendable on Halloween when the kids make their own plans. Meanwhile, Charlie tries to maintain his record for having the best decorated house in the neighborhood.

5.title: Teacher's Pest
5.plot: Aaron lands in hot water with his teacher, whom he calls a doofus-a word he heard Stephanie utter. Meanwhile, James uses Charlie in his plan to get out of doing his history homework.

6.title: James Goes Pro
6.plot: James learns that playing on a professional video gaming team is not what he thought it would be.

7.title: Drill Team
7.plot: Stephanie agrees to see a dentist to help Aaron get over his fears, but is nervous to discover the dentist is a face from her past.

8.title: Popular Mechanics
8.plot: James becomes popular when he is mistaken for a bad boy; Stephanie lectures James about doing the right thing.

9.title: Not Full House
9.plot: Stephanie and Charlie plan a child-free weekend in New York, only to find that Aaron has stowed away in their car; James and Gabby make plans while their parents are away.

10.title: How You Bike Me Now
10.plot: When both Stephanie and James face rejection, she signs them up for a bike race to prove that hard work pays off.

11.title: My Stupid Sweet Sixteen
11.plot: Stephanie plans a surprise party for Gabby's 16th birthday, but things don't go as she intended because of Maggie's mistake with the invitations.

12.title: Yelly Monster
12.plot: After Aaron describes Stephanie as a 'yelly monster' when she tries to get the family ready in the morning, Stephanie realizes that she must do better.

13.title: Ain't Misbehavin' or Else
13.plot: Stephanie's neighbor has better success getting the children to do things.

14.title: Instant Prom
14.plot: Noah asks Gabby to the prom, but she worries about fitting in at the after party; Stephanie and Charlie get overprotective.

15.title: Don't Worry, Be Maggie
15.plot: After reacting to Gabby's desire to get a tattoo, Stephanie worries that she is becoming like Maggie, and makes efforts to prove otherwise.

16.title: Ghost Busted
16.plot: Stephanie sees a horror movie with Gabby, despite Charlie's objections, and Stephanie winds up being frightened. Her fears then escalate when James tries to persuade her their house is haunted.

locations: Paramount Studios - 5555 Melrose Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA
imdb.plot outline: Stephanie is a former party girl who trades in her cocktails for carpools when she instantly adds three children to her life by marrying their father, Charlie. Needless to say, she struggles to find a balance between her fun-loving and slightly irresponsible lifestyle with being a full-time stepmother. As she learns what being a mother is about, partially with help from her own mom, Stephanie tries to do things her own way. Among the motherly experiences she has are being on the parents' dance committee and planning a 'staycation' for her family.
imdb.title: Instant Mom
plot: A 25-year-old party girl becomes an instant mom when she marries an older man with three children.::vhavnal

Stephanie is a former party girl who trades in her cocktails for carpools when she instantly adds three children to her life by marrying their father, Charlie. Needless to say, she struggles to find a balance between her fun-loving and slightly irresponsible lifestyle with being a full-time stepmother. As she learns what being a mother is about, partially with help from her own mom, Stephanie tries to do things her own way. Among the motherly experiences she has are being on the parents' dance committee and planning a 'staycation' for her family.::Anonymous
